<!-- # About me -->
# Toshiya Yoshida

I am a Ph.D. student in the [Department of Statistics](https://engineering.ucsc.edu/departments/statistics/) at [the University of California, Santa Cruz](https://www.ucsc.edu), advised by Prof. [Zehang Richard Li](https://zehangli.com/index.html).
I am interested in Bayesian statistics and its application to sociology, economics, and public health.
Currently, I am working on [verbal autopsy](https://www.who.int/standards/classifications/other-classifications/verbal-autopsy-standards-ascertaining-and-attributing-causes-of-death-tool) and developing statistical tools for a dynamic survey design. 
I am one of the [2023 Quad fellows](https://www.quadfellowship.org/quad-fellows).

Email: toyoshid (at) ucsc.edu
